required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Targeting CD19 and CD22 Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Lymphocytes in the Treatment of Recurrent or Refractory B Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of Targeting CD19 and CD22 Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Lymphocytes in the Treatment of Recurrent or Refractory B Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical Study of Targeting CD19 and CD22 Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Lymphocytes in the Treatment of Recurrent or Refractory B Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-arm, single-center, open clinical study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of GC022F injection in patients with relapsed or refractory B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with dose limiting toxicity (DLT) after cell infusion
Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of ORR (ORR = CR + CRi ) at Month 1,3,6,12,18and 24

arm_group.description: Each subject receive GC022F CAR T-cells by intravenous infusion

intervention.description: Each subject receive GC022F CAR-T cells by intravenous infusion

facility.name: The first affiliated hospital of medical college of zhejiang university
